Question 55 
 
A cylindrical rotor synchronous generator with constant real power output and constant terminal voltage 
is supplying 100 A current at 0.9 lagging power factor load. An ideal reactor is now connected in parallel 
with the load, as a result of which the total lagging reactive power requirement of the load is twice the 
previous value while the real power remains unchanged. The armature current is now ___________ A 
(rounded off to 2 decimal places). 
Ans. 
125.29
